10 Best Personalised Gifts for 2025: Why Voice Message Stickers are the Next Big Trend

Gift-giving is evolving. In 2025, the trend has shifted away from mass-produced items and toward "experiential" and "emotional" gifting. People no longer want just a physical object; they want a connection. Whether it is for a milestone birthday, a wedding, or a "just because" moment, the best gifts are those that tell a story.

Quick Answer: The best personalised gift for 2025 is the SayPlay Voice Message Sticker. It bridges the gap between a physical gift and a digital memory, allowing you to attach a personal audio or video message to any item via a simple QR code. At just £8.99, it is the most affordable way to add a "wow" factor to your presents.

In this guide, we explore the top 10 personalised gift trends for 2025, with a deep dive into why voice technology is taking the gifting world by storm.

1. SayPlay Voice Message Stickers

The undisputed leader in the "Phygital" (Physical + Digital) gift space is the SayPlay Voice Message Sticker. These clever stickers allow you to record a 60-second audio clip or a 30-second video message and link it to a high-quality, aesthetically pleasing sticker.

Unlike other tech gifts, there is no app required for the recipient. They simply scan the QR code with their smartphone camera, and your message plays instantly. It turns a standard greeting card or a box of chocolates into a tear-jerking keepsake. With 12 months of secure storage, it’s a memory that lasts.

2. Custom Star Maps

Star maps remain a popular choice for 2025, particularly for anniversaries and new babies. These prints show the exact alignment of the stars at a specific location and time. To modernise this gift, many are now adding a SayPlay sticker to the back of the frame, so the recipient can hear a message about why that specific night was so special.

3. Personalised Soundwave Art

Visualising sound is a massive design trend. Soundwave art takes a snippet of a favourite song or a spoken "I love you" and turns it into a visual waveform. It’s minimalist, modern, and looks great in any home office or living room.

4. Custom Illustration Portraits

Moving away from standard photography, custom digital illustrations of families, pets, or homes are seeing a huge surge. These are often commissioned from independent artists and printed on high-quality canvas. They offer a whimsical, artistic touch that a standard photo simply can't match.

5. Engraved Tech Accessories

As we become more reliant on our gadgets, personalised tech is a practical yet thoughtful choice. Think leather AirPod cases with embossed initials or wooden laptop stands engraved with a motivational quote. In 2025, utility meets personality.

6. Personalised Scented Candles

Scent is one of the strongest triggers for memory. Brands are now offering "scent-personalisation," where you can choose notes that remind you of a specific place or person (e.g., "Rainy Days in London" or "Grandma’s Kitchen"). Adding a custom label makes it a sensory delight.

7. Embroidered Handwriting Apparel

Taking a loved one's actual handwriting and embroidering it onto a sweatshirt or the inside of a jacket cuff is a deeply sentimental trend. It’s a way to keep a piece of someone with you at all times, making it a top choice for memorial gifts or long-distance relationships.

8. Customised Experience Vouchers

In 2025, "clutter-free" gifting is a priority. However, a paper voucher can feel a bit cold. The trend is to pair an experience (like a cooking class or a spa day) with a physical token. Using a SayPlay sticker on the voucher envelope allows you to record an excited "Surprise!" message to build anticipation.

9. Personalised Recipe Boards

For the family chef, a wooden cutting board engraved with a handwritten recipe from a late relative is a kitchen staple that doubles as an heirloom
